meanings.definition: The act of exhaling air from the lungs.
meanings.sent1: After a deep breath, the doctor asked for three quick expiries.
meanings.sent2: The yoga instructor reminded the class to focus on their expiries during the breathing exercises.
meanings.sent3: During the comedy show, the comedian joked about exaggerated expiries while imitating Darth Vader.
meanings.sent4: As the wind blew through the trees, it sounded like nature's gentle expiries after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The singer's powerful expiries on stage captivated the audience with each note.

meanings.definition: The end of a period of time or validity.
meanings.sent1: The expiries of the library books were clearly marked on the due date slip.
meanings.sent2: As the contract approached its expiries, negotiations for a new deal began.
meanings.sent3: The expiries of the coupon caused a rush of customers trying to use them before they expired.
meanings.sent4: The expiries of the warranty left the customer concerned about potential repair costs.
meanings.sent5: The expiries of the lease agreement meant it was time to start looking for a new apartment.

meanings.definition: The process of coming to an end or conclusion.
meanings.sent1: The expiries of the movie left the audience in awe of the unexpected twist.
meanings.sent2: With the expiries of the project deadline, the team celebrated their hard work paying off.
meanings.sent3: The expiries of the game brought both teams together for a friendly handshake.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the expiries of the day signaled the start of a peaceful evening.
meanings.sent5: The expiries of the meeting marked the beginning of new ideas and collaborations.
